storyInfo: Here ends the third story. The narration is now complete, and the storytellers revealed. A myth is born, and the nation of Tara rises. The one and only Red Dragon leads her people towards a new life, but her 'shadow' appears at Rhodes Island.

attributes.text: Just before the mother engaged the dark mist, the wakeman of the woods came to remind her that she had yet to do that which was most important: hold a proper funeral for her daughter.

The mother had intended to fight the dark mist to the death, but tears began to stream down her face when the wakeman sang their ancient song, and she chose to follow tradition and hold a wake for her daughter.

All through the night she cried at the purple bonfire representing her daughter's soul. The downpour of tears quenched the fire burning through the city, nearly extinguishing even the purple funeral fire.
When the wakeman once again asked the mother if she would still fight the dark mist to the death, she gazed upon the smoldering bonfire with tears on her face, saying,
As she said those words, the feeble purple flame suddenly turned bright yellow. Her daughter rose from death and walked out of the flames, and mother and daughter embraced each other.

attributes.content: So ends the story. Not in fragments, but a true...
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: ...ending.
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Congratulations. We've pieced together the truth.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: And what a happy ending!
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: This is all thanks to you! Come, let us toast, then I'll write this all down and publish it for—
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: Well, publishing it may be a, uh, a challenge. But now that it's complete—
attributes.name: Writer

attributes.content: The funeral, the bonfire, the resurrection... you saw everything.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: I never expected you to find the courage to return to Na Saoirsí.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: Singer.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: And it was a lovely ending, wasn't it? Eblana departed with the dead, never to return.
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: As for you, Your Highness Loughshinny, I dedicate this story to you. Whether to publish it, seal it away, or have it fade into obscurity along with the remnants of Dublinn like me—is all up to you.
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: How wonderful.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: I almost regret allowing you to belittle yourself with a title like The Singer.
attributes.name: Mysterious Woman

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Wait, what?!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: You're not Loughshinny. Y-You're—Eblana?!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: The once 'Singer' swings his arm furiously, spilling his drink on the table.
You're dead! You can't be alive! You were killed, twice! Once by spear, and once by fire—you shouldn't be here!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Or am I dead? Ha, haha... this isn't funny. You're dead, Red Dragon! Go back to where you belong!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: I see. That's it. It was all a lie. You never died. You killed Loughshinny instead. It was all a trick, an illusion—
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: If so, what becomes of your story?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: My... story?
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Have you calmed down?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You shouldn't be alive... no...
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Has death ever been an eternal sleep for me? What I could do with life, I can do with death.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: As a reward for completing the story, 'Writer', let me tell you one thing: All that matters is fire.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...The purple fire.
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: The purple fire from your story. It may seem ethereal, but it is no fiction.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: It is true that, over the long course of the war, I shared too much of my flame with others and became weak, feeble.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But fire spreads. Fire consumes. Fire grows.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: After the battle with the Nachzehrer on the Gastrell, I needed to take back the flames I had given away, which had been growing on the plains, in the ruins, in the hearts of the people.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You wanted it repaid... with interest.
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Taxation is the most basic authority of a monarch.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Mundane kings collect blood taxes to nurture their armies, to fight over land and people that will last mere centuries at most.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I collect blood taxes to pave a road between life and death with the Red Dragon's flame, so that all those caught in between will look up to me.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The ravings of a madwoman...
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: No doubt it sounds that way to you, for you cannot fathom what happens when enough death to consume a nation is returned to its master.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: A thousand years of anger, sorrow, and hatred converged on me all at once. Did you think they would let my flesh and spirit fade away so easily?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: A slave to hatred. What a fitting end for you—
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Have you already forgotten what I said in your story?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Everyone—and everything—that thought they could mold me just happened to take on a form I was able to wield with ease.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Were I truly their slave, you'd have been ash the moment I saw you.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: ...You lunatic!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: That's why you allowed Wellington to station his troops in the Dark Woods, to blockade the city, even continued the curfew... You never intended to spare Na Saoirsí!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Why thank you for finally being willing to shed light on the unpleasant truth of the dark mist and Wellington.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Does the Battle of Silverrock Bluffs, which you witnessed from the deck of the Gastrell, still haunts you in your alcohol-fueled dreams?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: It's never left you, has it? Why else would you be so obsessed with depicting the mist dangling above people's heads, yet so loathe to define it?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The curfew was justified at first. There were still Victorian spies in Na Saoirsí at the time indeed.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The Duke of Wellington stepped up the blockade when Loughshinny entered the city, because he wanted to smother any possibility of news leaking about the two red dragons.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: And the food that disappeared and came back on its own...
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: The Brigadier was more than just your most trusted lieutenant—he was also captain of Wellington's Redsteel Guard. When he went to ask for supplies, Wellington acquiesced.
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Wellington simply became disappointed in Loughshinny when she left Na Saoirsí to seek the wakemen, that's all.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You should thank her, really. You'd never have escaped the woods if Wellington hadn't relaxed the blockade out of disappointment.
attributes.name: Eblana
Eblana
attributes.content: As for the victory party you were so afraid to describe...

attributes.name: Eblana
attributes.content: Don't tell me you've really glorified it into a fairy tale in your memories?
Of course not...
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: What happened to the Dublinners who weren't willing to give up their power, the ones you took away on a pretext?
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: They were 'swallowed by the dark mist,' as you put it. Quite literally.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But Loughshinny still managed to make up her mind and killed you, and Wellington didn't follow your ridiculous orders!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Suppose I believe that your aberrant purple fire left you a vessel. What do you plan to do with it? Lead an army of the dead to retake Tara?
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: I won't help you. No living soul will. You and your dead friends can go straight to hell!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Indeed, you were never suited to be Dublinn's Singer.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You cling to what you see and believe. When the two could no longer be reconciled, you chose self-destruction rather than to give up on either.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But do you really imagine that everything has gone the way you think?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: A letter, Your Grace.
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.content: You may enter.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Is it urgent?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: N-No, ma'am.
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.content: But look at the seal. It corresponds to no emblem on record from the past fifty years...
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.content: Tara?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The Duke of Caster scrutinizes what the servant is holding.
On the edge of the envelope is an emblem excavated from the dusts of history.
The young have never seen it, while the old have forgotten it. Only those forced to keep an eye on history remember its source.
We are uncertain whether it is the mark of Tara... or of King Gaeil.
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.content: I never took you for a scholar of heraldry.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: That was not my intention. I just—
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.content: It is enough that we know what it signifies.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: 'To the Duke of Caster.'
Open it and read it out aloud.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Not too quickly.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am.
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.content: There is no greeting...
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.text: 'The response was delayed as the time was not yet ripe. Now, it is.'
'From this day forth, martial law is hereby lifted in Na Saoirsí and the surrounding lands south of the Grey Hills...'

attributes.content: Extra! Extra! Read all about it!
attributes.name: Newsboy

attributes.content: Martial law to be lifted at midnight across all of Tara!
attributes.name: Newsboy

attributes.content: Publishing restrictions lifted! The art community rejoices! Read more on page two—
attributes.name: Newsboy

attributes.content: Finally. Now we can call this a proper tavern.
attributes.name: Leisurely Resident

attributes.content: Hear, hear! With the curfew lifted, you can drink all through the night!
attributes.name: Barkeeper

attributes.content: Besides, it's my birthday! Drinks are on the house!
attributes.name: Barkeeper

attributes.content: R-Really?
attributes.name: Leisurely Resident

attributes.content: You sure about this? There are enough people in the city to drink you out of house and home.
attributes.name: Leisurely Resident

attributes.content: Worry about yourself. Look at you, rich boy, leaving your lamp on in the middle of the day!
attributes.name: Barkeeper

attributes.content: Tch, I was just so busy I forgot.
attributes.name: Leisurely Resident

attributes.content: It's been warm lately, so I've been renovating. Thought I'd take the day off. Guess I really have been too busy.
attributes.name: Leisurely Resident

attributes.content: So how about another beer? I've got to get this fatigue out of my system.
attributes.name: Leisurely Resident

attributes.content: Here you go.
attributes.name: Barkeeper

attributes.content: On the other hand, I'm almost more afraid of not being tired. Being tired is how I know I'm still breathing—no, that's not quite it. How should I put this—
attributes.name: Leisurely Resident

attributes.content: Living.
attributes.name: Barkeeper

attributes.content: Yes, living.
attributes.name: Leisurely Resident

attributes.content: You too, ma'am, here's one for you—
attributes.name: Barkeeper

attributes.content: Oh, it's you, Emma.
attributes.name: Barkeeper

attributes.content: I'm sorry. I've got to get going.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Off to do your time on the ag plate?
attributes.name: Barkeeper

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: No idea how you managed to smuggle all that food out last year, but I hear you've been paying it off with honest work over there. So no need to be shy now, have one on me.
attributes.name: Barkeeper

attributes.content: Thank you...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: To living.
attributes.name: Leisurely Resident

attributes.content: To Tara.
attributes.name: Barkeeper

attributes.content: To...
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: Emma holds the cup with one hand and puts the other in her pocket, clutching the necklace she reclaimed last winter.
The words said to her when it was returned come out of her mouth almost by instinct.
...To all our countrymen who gave their lives for Tara.
attributes.name: Worried Resident

attributes.content: You're really leaving, Brigid?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Yeah, the burdenbeasts are callin' for me from their pastures.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Besides, still haven't been to this 'Rhodes Island' that Loughshinny wanted me to see. Want to come with?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Maybe if I have the chance.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: It's just sad to think that you're the one who brought us to Na Saoirsí, but can't stay yourself.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: It's not that I couldn't, I just chose not to. Like your own choice to stay.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Say hi to the wakemen for me, if they come back to the city.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Is that your intuition again?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: It's not always right.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: But I don't smell that burning stink anymore. Smells like fresh buds in spring, dew in the morning.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: Hello, Brigadier.
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: You two know each other?
attributes.name: Brigid

attributes.content: You could say that.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: What are you doing here? I don't recall anything happening which the Redsteel Guard would need to be deployed for.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I'm on leave. I came to honor the memory of my comrades... scoundrels, to be sure, but they fought by my side.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: If you're looking to take revenge for those who died during your exile, this is your chance. A brawl with a soldier on leave wouldn't be considered an attack on the military.
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: ...It wasn't you who killed Selmon and the others. Not directly.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I'll remember what you did. That's enough for me.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.content: What more can anyone ask for, than to be remembered?
attributes.name: The Brigadier

attributes.text: '...Bealtaine, also known as the Festival of Fire, is scheduled to be revived in the coming days.'
'The fire-passing ritual will start in Oak Grove County.'

attributes.content: You're awfully quiet. Are you nervous?
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: No, it just strikes me that we managed to turn what you'd see in the books into reality.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: On the last day of spring, we extinguish the fires in our homes, then come together to relight them at Bealtaine. In the smoke of the bonfire and drifting ash...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: We welcome the coming of a new season, and of a new life.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Your Highness Loughshinny, the lighting ceremony will begin in a few minutes—
attributes.name: A Voice

attributes.content: Alright, thank you.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Maybe I've waited too long for this. It feels no realer than a dream.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I wanted to sing, Nemos, but you've already sung for me back in Na Saoirsí... So this time, the flames in my hand will do the singing.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: One more thing, Your Highness... about Her Highness Eblana—
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Your Highness! It's time!
attributes.name: A Voice

attributes.content: Sorry, Nemos. We can speak after the ritual.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: The Draco steps forward.
A stone platform, sculpted in the style of the ruins, serves as her lectern. She lights the bonfire upon it, and turns around.
From the square below her, many faces gaze up with bated breath.
She takes a deep breath.
A thousand years ago, the Dracos of Victoria invaded Tara, creating the title of King Gaeil as an epithet of shame, robbing the nomadic Tarans of their freedom.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Six hundred years ago, the reigning King Gaeil had no choice but to allow the Victorians to remake the royal capital in their own image.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Two hundred years ago, the Aslans seized the crown of Victoria, but once again they trampled the dreams of the Tarans beneath their feet, such that even our language was almost lost to us.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Now, Tara stands on her own.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I recite this history of shame, not to fan the flames of hatred, but in defense of peace.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Sing what songs in Victorian suffice to praise the beauty you see.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Tell what tales in Taran will move the passions.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: We remember so that we might provide the living the dignity of life, and the dead the promise of reunion.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Throughout the cold night...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: We shall retain a warm flame.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: As such, I, Loughshinny Dublinn, the last descendent of the Taran Dracos...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.text: 'I shall light this fire symbolizing new life. May it guide the way for all, whether living or departed.'

attributes.content: 'Enclosed you will find templates for nomadic city immigration forms.'
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.content: Signed... 'The Kingdom of Tara'.
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.content: This is... This is treason.
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.content: The King of Tara has long been one of the titles of the Victorian emperor. Nothing in this letter denies it.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: To avoid conflict, the Red Dragon has even indefinitely delayed the 'coronation' so many are looking forward to.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: But in reality...
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.content: In reality, the indecisive claimant, the corrupt oligarchs, the blockading army, and the flames of dissent... all these issues have been put to rest.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: For the first time in centuries, they proudly tell a new legend of a King Gaeil.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: In the short term, the unrest has indeed been contained within Wellington's domain. With time, however, it can become a greater threat than any insurrection.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Tara must not be allowed to secede from Victoria.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: As long as Wellington doesn't take his entire territory away on a nomadic city, the other dukes and I will continue negotiating with him.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am. I'll draft some long terms plans regarding that.
attributes.name: Solemn Servant

attributes.content: Phew... It's finally over...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Well done. Well done indeed.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: So what was it you wanted to say about Eblana before the ceremony?
attributes.name: Loughshinny
Nemos
attributes.content: We never found her body. If she somehow survived, I worry that someday...

attributes.name: Nemos
attributes.content: Someday a completely different story will be told about the resurrection of the Red Dragon.
What story? That it was no miracle, but the assassination of one dragon by another?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Worse than that.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I see. You're afraid that Eblana will return and paint the whole thing as a conspiracy I orchestrated.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Our position is not unassailable.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: We both know that her body disappeared earlier that night, after you killed her the first time. What I dragged through the streets wasn't her body, but an empty coffin.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: I also know that it was I who used the last spark of fire she left in her spear to ignite the coffin.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: It was I who left the city to parlay with Wellington, laying out our plans in exchange for him delaying military action while they played out.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: It was I who walked into the fire the people had returned to Eblana, I who quenched and replaced the fire of death with the fire of life, and I who walked out of the fire in the end.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: We've known all this since that day on the balcony of Na Saoirsí's citadel.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Eblana had left us a puzzle with no solution. The only way out was a miracle.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: A miracle we scripted and directed.
attributes.name: Nemos

attributes.content: If anything, the true miracle was the wakemen returning to the city.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: If Eblana hadn't awakened the Exiled King, if Brigid hadn't delivered that message centuries overdue, if Moran hadn't persuaded them...
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: With just the two of us, that miracle could never have occurred.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: So, what is there to fear at this point?
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Eblana has cut off any path leading away from the throne. All I can do is devote the rest of my days to Tara.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: And patiently await my judgment in some unknowable future.
attributes.name: Loughshinny

attributes.content: Nemos was dragging an empty coffin?! Loughshinny was planning to 'resurrect the dragon' the moment she first killed you?
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: You're lying! You—
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: I know! It was Wellington! He found a conscience and lifted the blockade on his own!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: You just won't give up, will you?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The Iron Duke? With a conscience? Hilarious.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: You promised him that only good could come of your scheming!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: All I promised him on the Gastrell was that I could change the direction of Tara, so long as Loughshinny was willing to return.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The Red Dragon who breathes flames of death, the spectre force with its dead soldiers, Dublinn with its blood-stained hands... everything was fated to sink into darkness while the Tarans united under the banner of the one and only Red Dragon.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Of course, His Grace was unaware that everyone in Na Saoirsí was meant to die for the plan, but I knew.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: A city of doomed souls in exchange for Tara's lasting stability. Only good could come of it, no?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: A shame that the duke isn't fond of Loughshinny. Things could have gone even more smoothly otherwise.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Sophistry! You lied to Wellington! Your plan was anything but harmless! And the people of Na Saoirsí did live!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: To everyone's surprise.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: In exchange for their lives, Loughshinny reached for the scepter of power that she detested so much. She chose to write a saga, a novel, a miracle that should have been beneath her noble dignity.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: It was something only she could do... something that wouldn't have been possible even a few years ago. Would you have placed a miracle on the scales from the start?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: What if Loughshinny had failed?!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Then you wouldn't be sitting here enjoying your drink.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I'm sure you've heard stories about what the Iron Duke does to whatever he considers an obstacle.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Every story begins with an inspiration. Memories rush into the writer's mind like seawater at high tide.
He struggles to break free, only to find himself powerless against the oncoming tide.
Argh—ugh! *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Red Dragon...
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: You knew! You knew from the beginning!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Y-You almost destroyed Na Saoirsí! You've made a mockery of all Tara!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Now, now, I must object to that. I simply fulfilled a promise. Is being true to one's word no longer a virtue?
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Even you yourself admitted that this was a 'happy ending'.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: No—never! This isn't how the story ends—
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: This isn't how my story's supposed to go!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: The writer sees a sliver of white. He falls to his knees and crawls along the ground, trying to collect the scattered sheets of paper that had flown loose.
One, two, three... He clutches them in his hand along with his pen.
No, no, no—
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: What would you like to write? Let me help you.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: No—
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: NOOOO!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: The writer's shoulders tremble hysterically. Panicked, he begins to back off, until his back hits the rickety wall of the tavern.
Grabbing his pen like a spear, he begins to stab at the paper.
Muttering under his breath, he only manages to cover them with scattered ink blots. Soon, even his muttering loses coherence.
Gah... brr... argh... ugh! Ugh!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: The commotion causes the drunken barkeep to come out from behind the counter and grab him by the collar.
Wha'cha babblin' about?
attributes.name: Brusque Barkeep

attributes.content: Argh! Eh... ugh!
attributes.name: 'The Singer'

attributes.content: Realizing that he can no longer form words, the writer looks desperately towards the woman watching him with disinterest.
He points at the woman's hands, then at his own mouth. The meaning was clear.
You've lost your words.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Perhaps you hit your head from excitement, or had a minor stroke.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Or perhaps it's because you just saw something you believed in so firmly, for so long, shatter to pieces.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: The very thing that inspired you to join Dublinn, caused you to stay at the victory party, made you turn back to Na Saoirsí halfway...
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: But it's time to wake up.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: With a trembling hand, the writer tries to write on his palm, but leaves only crooked, disjointed lines.
You wrote a story for Tara. A complete story, not a collection of fragments. It's a good one. I like it.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: And I like it even more now that it belongs only to me, not to you.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Slán go fóill, 'Singer'. No, 'Writer'.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: Slán go fóill, the last Dublinner.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: I look forward to the stories you'll tell me when death reunites us.
attributes.name: Eblana

attributes.content: With one last glance at The Writer, the woman tosses a few coins onto the table, and walks out of the tavern.
A memory comes back to The Writer.

It was the same look Eblana gave him that night, a year and a half ago, when he decided to delay his report after The Leader's shadow had already departed, in hopes staying in both sides' good graces.

attributes.options: What should I call you, then?

attributes.content: Whatever you're thinking, I am only Necrass here.
Unless you, too, find a signed sheet of paper to hold no power whatsoever.
If you find the title necessary, Erudite.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: For my part, I'm more curious about your lack of reaction upon hearing the whole story.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.options: I read the report on Na Saoirsí.;I've already heard the story.

attributes.content: Ah. A lapse on my part, I see.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: First a private letter from Na Saoirsí, then fragments through official channels... Loughshinny is getting better at this.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: Then I presume she's told you all about me, which is why you were willing to sit down with me by yourself, and hear out this patchwork tale of allusions and insinuations.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.options: No, she has yet to 'find your body.';She's unaware you're in a position to tell stories.

attributes.content: That makes your courage all the more admirable.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: And I mustn't neglect to give credit to Loughshinny where it's due. She's more than just a qualified dance partner now—she's ready to take the lead. I do hope she enjoys herself.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.options: Sounds like you like your new powers.;Sounds like you like your new toy.

attributes.content: Of course I do. The powers of the dead aren't necessarily greater than those of the living, but they are more lasting, and harder to check.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.options: But you'll soon grow bored of them.
Like everything else you've ever had.

attributes.content: Life is short, but death is long, Erudite.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: There are still so many interesting people in the mortal realm. That alone is reason enough for me to await them in death.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.options: So you gave Reed your old toys?

attributes.content: A cutting question, Erudite. But I'll allow it.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: And not only because your accusation is astute, if prejudiced. But also because you are one of the interesting people I mentioned.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.options: What are you intending?;What makes me interesting?

attributes.content: Must everything be done for a purpose?
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: I am inseparable from death. Is it not the natural order of things that those like me should be drawn to Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: I was drawn, so I came. This place is always covered in the scent of death, after all—especially around you, my dear Erudite.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: You will, someday.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: When the tides erupt and the night of death descends, you will be grateful for my presence, so long as I do not mock your predicament.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: As for right now?
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: I am simply the shadow of Tara's leader.
attributes.name: Necrass

attributes.content: Just Necrass, nothing more.
attributes.name: Necrass
